alert.note: Alert for Chuckwalla Mountains; Chuckwalla Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 25 at 7:13PM PDT by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Riverside County through 800 PM PDT... At 713 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 20 miles southeast of Desert Center. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of Riverside County. This includes CA Interstate 10 between mile markers 117 and 131. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
